title: Grilled Tuna Teriyaki Recipe
description: This tasty tuna marinade makes a good thing even better. Soy sauce, fresh ginger, rice wine, garlic, and oil are poured over fresh tuna steaks and left to marinate briefly in the fridge.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Seafood Fish Tuna Grilled Tuna Teriyaki 4.4 (82) 56 Reviews 4 Photos Delicious right off the grill! Take care not to overcook the steaks, as tuna can quickly become quite dry. By Allrecipes Member Updated on January 14, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 4 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Additional Time: 30 mins Total Time: 55 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 4 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 tablespoons light soy sauce 1 tablespoon Chinese rice wine 1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger root 1 large clove garlic, minced 4 (6 ounce) tuna steaks (about 3/4 inch thick) 1 tablespoon vegetable oil Directions Stir soy sauce, rice wine, ginger, and garlic together in a shallow dish. Place tuna in the marinade, and turn to coat. Cover dish and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Preheat grill for medium-high heat. Remove tuna from marinade and discard remaining liquid. Brush both sides of steaks with oil. Cook tuna on the preheated grill until cooked through, 3 to 6 minutes per side. Editor's Note: The nutrition data for this recipe includes the full amount of the marinade ingredients. The actual amount of the marinade consumed will vary. I Made It Print 90 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Grilled Tuna Teriyaki 01 of 04 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 04 Photo by  Valerie Weiler-Hinch 06/29/2014 YUM!!! VERY flavorful marinade. I added 1/2 tablespoon of brown sugar and a bit of sesame oil to the marinade, which I had the tuna in for about 4 hours. Weather forced us to switch from the outdoor grill to stove top, but for my first time grilling tuna steaks, this was a great intro!! 03 of 04 Photo by  AcaCandy 03/06/2014 I love the marinade. Instead of tossing it out, which in my opinion is a waste of great garlic and ginger, I sautéed the Tuna in a frying pan along with the marinade. Such a great flavor as the marinade cooks down. Just be careful not to overcook the tuna. 04 of 04 Photo by  SummerRain 04/04/2005 I more than doubled the marinade for 2 tuna steaks, added 1 teaspoon brown sugar, a bit of oyster sauce, a dash of sesame oil, and chopped chives. Boiled the leftover of the marinade and thickened it to pour over the grilled tuna (I did pour more water in and seasoned it to make more sauce). 1 You’ll Also Love Grilled Tuna 56 Ratings Grilled Tuna Fish Steaks 27 Ratings Grilled Swordfish with Rosemary 190 Ratings Marinated Grilled Shrimp 3,642 Ratings Sea Bass Barbecue 9 Ratings Grilled Shrimp and Apple Skewers 103 Ratings Halibut with Rice Wine 171 Ratings Simply Swordfish 92 Ratings Grilled Salmon 5,610 Ratings Grilled Halibut II 39 Ratings Grilled Teriyaki Tuna 141 Ratings Alaskan Cod and Shrimp with Fresh Tomato 202 Ratings Lemon-Orange Orange Roughy 256 Ratings Salmon Tango 238 Ratings Spinach-Stuffed Flounder with Mushrooms and Feta 159 Ratings Greek Pork Tenderloin 457 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Allrecipes Member
instructions: Stir soy sauce, rice wine, ginger, and garlic together in a shallow dish. Place tuna in the marinade, and turn to coat. Cover dish and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.;Preheat grill for medium-high heat.;Remove tuna from marinade and discard remaining liquid. Brush both sides of steaks with oil.;Cook tuna on the preheated grill until cooked through, 3 to 6 minutes per side.
